title.narrative: OPT 2.6.3: CP LEGAL AND POLICIES

description.narrative: 2.6.3 Capacity of public institutions (national and subnational), within the framework of protection, have an improved legal framework and strengthened its capacity to plan, coordinate, implement, and monitor cost-effective interventions, with a rights- based and equity-based approach., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2.6 By 2017, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, are protected by a judicial framework that is aligned with international standards and have access to protection programs and services (including timely birth registration), that prevent and protect them from violence, negligence, abuse and exploitation

Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.6.3 Capacity of public institutions (national and subnational), within the framework of protection, have an improved legalframework and strengthened its capacity to plan, coordinate, implement, and monitor cost-effective interventions, with a rights-based and equity-based approach.

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed significantly to the development of regulations, policies and protection programs at the local level, especially for eradication of worst forms of child labor, the right to live within a family, juvenile justice, and VAC. The major challenge is to support the functioning of the National Child Protection System | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of innovative intervention models to protect children from all forms of violence.

actual.value: 2017:4Zero Children Undocumented in the MunicipalitiesPrevention and integral care for children in street situationsAlternative Measures to Deprivation of Liberty for adolescents in conflict with the lawChild Friendly and Adolescents Markets

title.narrative: Number of policies and plans developed (at national and sub national levels), that use a gender and intercultural approach, to protect children and adolescents.
Number of approved legal instruments (law and regulations, at national and subnational levels) banning different all forms of violence against children.
